trans-unit.source: Missing '{0}' attribute.
trans-unit.target: Missing '{0}' attribute.

trans-unit.source: Missing diagnostic analyzer attribute.
trans-unit.target: Missing diagnostic analyzer attribute.

trans-unit.source: Non-abstract sub-types of DiagnosticAnalyzer should be marked with DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute(s). The argument to this attribute(s), if any, determine the supported languages for the analyzer. Analyzer types without this attribute will be ignored by the analysis engine.
trans-unit.target: Non-abstract sub-types of DiagnosticAnalyzer should be marked with DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute(s). The argument to this attribute(s), if any, determine the supported languages for the analyzer. Analyzer types without this attribute will be ignored by the analysis engine.

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic analyzer '{0}' may be able to support both C# and Visual Basic. Consider adding an argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute for '{1}' language support.
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic analyzer '{0}' may be able to support both C# and Visual Basic. Consider adding an argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute for '{1}' language support.

trans-unit.source: Recommend adding language support to diagnostic analyzer.
trans-unit.target: Recommend adding language support to diagnostic analyzer.

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic analyzer is marked as supporting only one language, but the analyzer assembly doesn't seem to refer to any language specific CodeAnalysis assemblies, and so is likely to work for more than one language. Consider adding an additional language argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute.
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic analyzer is marked as supporting only one language, but the analyzer assembly doesn't seem to refer to any language specific CodeAnalysis assemblies, and so is likely to work for more than one language. Consider adding an additional language argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute.

trans-unit.source: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for both '{0}' and '{1}'.
trans-unit.target: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for both '{0}' and '{1}'.

trans-unit.source: Specify at least one SymbolKind of interest when registering a symbol analyzer action.
trans-unit.target: Specify at least one SymbolKind of interest when registering a symbol analyzer action.

trans-unit.source: Specify at least one SyntaxKind of interest when registering a syntax node analyzer action.
trans-unit.target: Specify at least one SyntaxKind of interest when registering a syntax node analyzer action.

trans-unit.source: Specify at least one OperationKind of interest when registering an operation analyzer action.
trans-unit.target: Specify at least one OperationKind of interest when registering an operation analyzer action.

trans-unit.source: Missing kind argument when registering an analyzer action.
trans-unit.target: Missing kind argument when registering an analyzer action.

trans-unit.source: You must specify at least one syntax, symbol or operation kind when registering a syntax, symbol, or operation analyzer action respectively. Otherwise, the registered action will never be invoked during analysis.
trans-unit.target: You must specify at least one syntax, symbol or operation kind when registering a syntax, symbol, or operation analyzer action respectively. Otherwise, the registered action will never be invoked during analysis.

trans-unit.source: SymbolKind '{0}' is not supported for symbol analyzer actions.
trans-unit.target: SymbolKind '{0}' is not supported for symbol analyzer actions.

trans-unit.source: Unsupported SymbolKind argument when registering a symbol analyzer action.
trans-unit.target: Unsupported SymbolKind argument when registering a symbol analyzer action.

trans-unit.source: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor.
trans-unit.target: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor.

trans-unit.source: ReportDiagnostic should only be invoked with supported DiagnosticDescriptors that are returned from DiagnosticAnalyzer.SupportedDiagnostics property. Otherwise, the reported diagnostic will be filtered out by the analysis engine.
trans-unit.target: ReportDiagnostic should only be invoked with supported DiagnosticDescriptors that are returned from DiagnosticAnalyzer.SupportedDiagnostics property. Otherwise, the reported diagnostic will be filtered out by the analysis engine.

trans-unit.source: Type argument '{0}' for type parameter '{1}' of method '{2}' is not a SyntaxKind enum.
trans-unit.target: Type argument '{0}' for type parameter '{1}' of method '{2}' is not a SyntaxKind enum.

trans-unit.source: Invalid type argument for DiagnosticAnalyzer's Register method.
trans-unit.target: Invalid type argument for DiagnosticAnalyzer's Register method.

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticAnalyzer's language-specific Register methods, such as RegisterSyntaxNodeAction, RegisterCodeBlockStartAction and RegisterCodeBlockEndAction, expect a language-specific 'SyntaxKind' type argument for it's '{0}' type parameter. Otherwise, the registered analyzer action can never be invoked during analysis.
trans-unit.target: DiagnosticAnalyzer's language-specific Register methods, such as RegisterSyntaxNodeAction, RegisterCodeBlockStartAction and RegisterCodeBlockEndAction, expect a language-specific 'SyntaxKind' type argument for it's '{0}' type parameter. Otherwise, the registered analyzer action can never be invoked during analysis.

trans-unit.source: Start action has no registered non-end actions.
trans-unit.target: Start action has no registered non-end actions.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions. Consider moving actions registered in '{1}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions. Consider moving actions registered in '{1}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: Start action has no registered actions.
trans-unit.target: Start action has no registered actions.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions, except for a '{1}'. Consider replacing this start/end action pair with a '{2}' or moving actions registered in '{3}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions, except for a '{1}'. Consider replacing this start/end action pair with a '{2}' or moving actions registered in '{3}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: An analyzer start action enables performing stateful analysis over a given code unit, such as a code block, compilation, etc. Careful design is necessary to achieve efficient analyzer execution without memory leaks. Use the following guidelines for writing such analyzers: 1. Define a new scope for the registered start action, possibly with a private nested type for analyzing each code unit. 2. If required, define and initialize state in the start action. 3. Register at least one non-end action that refers to this state in the start action. If no such action is necessary, consider replacing the start action with a non-start action. For example, a CodeBlockStartAction with no registered actions or only a registered CodeBlockEndAction should be replaced with a CodeBlockAction. 4. If required, register an end action to report diagnostics based on the final state.
trans-unit.target: An analyzer start action enables performing stateful analysis over a given code unit, such as a code block, compilation, etc. Careful design is necessary to achieve efficient analyzer execution without memory leaks. Use the following guidelines for writing such analyzers: 1. Define a new scope for the registered start action, possibly with a private nested type for analyzing each code unit. 2. If required, define and initialize state in the start action. 3. Register at least one non-end action that refers to this state in the start action. If no such action is necessary, consider replacing the start action with a non-start action. For example, a CodeBlockStartAction with no registered actions or only a registered CodeBlockEndAction should be replaced with a CodeBlockAction. 4. If required, register an end action to report diagnostics based on the final state.

trans-unit.source: Consider providing localizable arguments of type '{0}' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure the descriptor is localizable.
trans-unit.target: Consider providing localizable arguments of type '{0}' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure the descriptor is localizable.

trans-unit.source: Provide localizable arguments to diagnostic descriptor constructor.
trans-unit.target: Provide localizable arguments to diagnostic descriptor constructor.

trans-unit.source: If your diagnostic analyzer and it's reported diagnostics need to be localizable, then the supported DiagnosticDescriptors used for constructing the diagnostics must also be localizable. If so, then localizable argument(s) must be provided for parameter 'title' (and optionally 'description') to the diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure that the descriptor is localizable.
trans-unit.target: If your diagnostic analyzer and it's reported diagnostics need to be localizable, then the supported DiagnosticDescriptors used for constructing the diagnostics must also be localizable. If so, then localizable argument(s) must be provided for parameter 'title' (and optionally 'description') to the diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure that the descriptor is localizable.

trans-unit.source: Avoid storing per-compilation data of type '{0}' into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.
trans-unit.target: Avoid storing per-compilation data of type '{0}' into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.

trans-unit.source: Avoid storing per-compilation data into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.
trans-unit.target: Avoid storing per-compilation data into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.

trans-unit.source: Instance of a diagnostic analyzer might outlive the lifetime of compilation. Hence, storing per-compilation data, such as symbols, into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer might cause stale compilations to stay alive and cause memory leaks. Instead, you should store this data on a separate type instantiated in a compilation start action, registered using '{0}.{1}' API. An instance of this type will be created per-compilation and it won't outlive compilation's lifetime, hence avoiding memory leaks.
trans-unit.target: Instance of a diagnostic analyzer might outlive the lifetime of compilation. Hence, storing per-compilation data, such as symbols, into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer might cause stale compilations to stay alive and cause memory leaks. Instead, you should store this data on a separate type instantiated in a compilation start action, registered using '{0}.{1}' API. An instance of this type will be created per-compilation and it won't outlive compilation's lifetime, hence avoiding memory leaks.

trans-unit.source: The author of this interface did not intend to have third party implementations of this interface and reserves the right to change it. Implementing this interface could therefore result in a source or binary compatibility issue with a future version of this interface.
trans-unit.target: The author of this interface did not intend to have third party implementations of this interface and reserves the right to change it. Implementing this interface could therefore result in a source or binary compatibility issue with a future version of this interface.

trans-unit.source: Type {0} cannot implement interface {1} because {1} is not available for public implementation.
trans-unit.target: Type {0} cannot implement interface {1} because {1} is not available for public implementation.

trans-unit.source: Only internal implementations of this interface are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only internal implementations of this interface are allowed.

trans-unit.source: A CodeFixProvider that intends to support fix all occurrences must classify the registered code actions into equivalence classes by assigning it an explicit, non-null equivalence key which is unique across all registered code actions by this fixer. This enables the FixAllProvider to fix all diagnostics in the required scope by applying code actions from this fixer that are in the equivalence class of the trigger code action.
trans-unit.target: A CodeFixProvider that intends to support fix all occurrences must classify the registered code actions into equivalence classes by assigning it an explicit, non-null equivalence key which is unique across all registered code actions by this fixer. This enables the FixAllProvider to fix all diagnostics in the required scope by applying code actions from this fixer that are in the equivalence class of the trigger code action.

trans-unit.source: Provide an explicit argument for optional parameter '{0}', which is non-null and unique across all code actions created by this fixer.
trans-unit.target: Provide an explicit argument for optional parameter '{0}', which is non-null and unique across all code actions created by this fixer.

trans-unit.source: Create code actions should have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.
trans-unit.target: Create code actions should have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' has the default value of 'null' for property '{1}'. Either override this property on '{0}' to return a non-null and unique value across all code actions per-fixer or use such an existing code action.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' has the default value of 'null' for property '{1}'. Either override this property on '{0}' to return a non-null and unique value across all code actions per-fixer or use such an existing code action.

trans-unit.source: Use code actions that have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.
trans-unit.target: Use code actions that have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.

trans-unit.source: Many objects exposed by Roslyn are immutable. The return value from a method invocation on these objects should not be ignored.
trans-unit.target: Many objects exposed by Roslyn are immutable. The return value from a method invocation on these objects should not be ignored.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' is immutable and '{1}' will not have any effect on it. Consider using the return value from '{1}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' is immutable and '{1}' will not have any effect on it. Consider using the return value from '{1}'.

trans-unit.source: Do not ignore values returned by methods on immutable objects.
trans-unit.target: Do not ignore values returned by methods on immutable objects.
